tit.cmt: ・本文にUshioniという地名がでてきて、何のことか分からなくなるので、英語は括弧書きで次項に入れました。

sen.j: 牛鬼（うしおに、ぎゅうき）は、西日本に伝わる妖怪。
sen.e: The cow demon is a specter handed down in western Japan.
Ushioni (cow demon), or gyuki, is a specter orally handed down in western Japan.
sen.cmt: ・cow demonは固有名詞的な扱いなので無冠詞に変更・ピリオド後のスペースを削除（以下、同）
sen.e: Ushioni (cow demon), or gyuki, is a specter orally handed down in western Japan.

sen.j: 主に海岸に現れ、浜辺を歩く人間を襲うとされている。
sen.e: It is believed to appear in coasts and attack people walking along the beach.
It is believed to appear mainly on the coast and attack people walking along the beach.
sen.cmt: ・「主に」のmainlyを追加・coastの前置詞はonに変更
sen.e: It is believed to appear mainly on the coast and attack people walking along the beach.

sen.j: 非常に残忍・獰猛な性格で、毒を吐き、人を食い殺すことを好む。
sen.e: It has a quite cruel and fierce character and likes killing people by vomiting a poison.
It has quite a cruel and fierce character, spatters poison from its mouth, and likes to kill people by biting them.
sen.cmt: ・quiteは冠詞の前に来るほうが普通なので変更。・vomitは、げろを吐くことなので変更。吐きかけるというニュアンスに変更。
sen.e: It has quite a cruel and fierce character, spatters poison from its mouth, and likes to kill people by biting them.

sen.j: 伝承では、頭がウシで首から下は鬼の胴体を持つ。
sen.e: A legend says that it has the head of a cow and the body of a demon from the neck down.
According to legend, it had a head of the cow and a body of the demon from the neck down.
sen.cmt: ・"the head of a cow"は「ある牛のその頭」、「牛というものの頭」は"a head of the cow"なので変更しました。・過去形に変更しました。
sen.e: According to legend, it had a head of the cow and a body of the demon from the neck down.

sen.j: または、その逆に頭が鬼で、胴体は牛の場合もある。
sen.e: Another legend says the opposite: it has the head of a demon and the body of a cow.
Sometimes, it had a reverse appearance: a head of the demon and a body of the cow.
sen.cmt: ・上記と同じ理由で変更・過去形に変更しました。
sen.e: Sometimes, it had a reverse appearance: a head of the demon and a body of the cow.

sen.j: さらに別の伝承では、牛の首でクモの胴体を持っていたともされる。
sen.e: Furthermore a different legend says it has the head of a cow and the body of a spider.
Another legend says it had a head of the cow and a body of the spider.
sen.cmt: ・上記と同じ理由で変更・過去形に変更しました。
sen.e: Another legend says it had a head of the cow and a body of the spider.

sen.j: また、山間部の寺院の門前に、牛の首に人の着物姿で頻繁に現れたとの伝承もある。
sen.e: In addition, it is said to have frequently appeared in front of the gate of temples in a mountainous region in a shape of having the head of a cow and in kimono.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There is also a legend that says it frequently appeared in front of the gates of temples in the mountainous regions in the shape of a head of the cow and a body in kimono.
sen.cmt: ・日本語が「一原文一訳文例外対処」用に編集されておらず、英語に対応していなかったので、修正しました。
sen.e: There is also a legend that says it frequently appeared in front of the gates of temples in the mountainous regions in the shape of a head of the cow and a body in kimono.

sen.j: 牛の首、鬼の体に昆虫の羽を持ち、空から飛来したとの伝承もある。
sen.e: It is also said to have come flying from the sky with the head of a cow and wings of a insect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is also said, in legend, to have come flying from the sky with a head of the cow and wings of the insect.
It is also said, in legend, to have come flying from the sky with a head of the cow and wings of the insect.

sen.j: 海岸の他、山間部、森や林の中、川、沼、湖にも現れるとされる。
sen.e: It is also believed to appear in mountainous regions, woods and groves, rivers, swamps, and lakes, in addition to oceans.
It is also believed to appear in the mountainous regions, woods, groves, rivers, swamps, and lakes, as well as on the beaches.
sen.cmt: ・海岸なのでbeachに変更しました。・andは最後の項目だけにしました。
sen.e: It is also believed to appear in the mountainous regions, woods, groves, rivers, swamps, and lakes, as well as on the beaches.

sen.j: 特に淵に現れることが多く、近畿地方や四国にはこの伝承が伺える「牛鬼淵」・「牛鬼滝」という地名が多く残っている。
sen.e: In particular it often appears in abysses, so there remain many place-names considered to be linked with these legends such as "Ushioni-buchi" and "Ushioni-daki" in Kinki and Shikoku regions.

It often appears particularly around deep waters, so there remain many place-names such as 'Ushioni-buchi' (Ushioni-buchi abyss, or Ushioni-buchi deep pond) or 'Ushioni-daki' (Ushioni-daki falls) in the Kinki and Shikoku regions, where legends about Ushioni may have existed.
sen.cmt: ・in abyssesだと、「深海に」「深遠に」などの意味になってしまうので変更しました。・appearを過去形に変更しました。・「この伝承が伺える」という文章を改変しました。
sen.e: It often appears particularly around deep waters, so there remain many place-names such as 'Ushioni-buchi' (Ushioni-buchi abyss, or Ushioni-buchi deep pond) or 'Ushioni-daki' (Ushioni-daki falls) in the Kinki and Shikoku regions, where legends about Ushioni may have existed.

sen.j: 各地の伝承

Legends in various regions

sen.j: 和歌山県
sen.e: Wakayama Prefecture
Wakayama Prefecture
Wakayama Prefecture

sen.j: 和歌山県西牟婁郡の牛鬼淵は、底が海にまで通じており、淵の水が濁ると「牛鬼がいる」といわれた。
sen.e: In a abyss named Ushioni-buchi in Nishimuro-gun, Wakayama Prefecture, whose bottom extends to the sea, people said, "A cow demon is in the abyss," when water became muddy.
Ushioni-buchi in Nishimuro County, Wakayama Prefecture, whose bottom was believed to have been connected to the sea, was said, "Ushioni is in it," when the water color became muddy.
sen.cmt: ・仕様によりCountyに変更しました。・Ushioni-buchiを主語にするように文を改変しました。・extend toをbe connected toに変更しました。・waterをwater colorに変更しました。
sen.e: Ushioni-buchi in Nishimuro County, Wakayama Prefecture, whose bottom was believed to have been connected to the sea, was said, "Ushioni is in it," when the water color became muddy.

sen.j: ここの牛鬼は出会っただけで人を病気に至らしめたり、影を嘗め取ることでその人を食い殺すという。
sen.e: It is said that the cow demon there causes people to suffer from a disease only by seeing it or bites people to death by licking their shadows.
This Ushioni was believed to have made people suffer from a disease if people just came across it, or bitten people to death by licking their shadows off.
This Ushioni was believed to have made people suffer from a disease if people just came across it, or bitten people to death by licking their shadows off.

sen.j: このようなときは「石は流れる、木の葉は沈む、牛は嘶く、馬は吼える」などと逆の言葉を言うと、命が助かるという。
sen.e: The way to save their life in such a case is said to say the other way around: "Stones flow, leaves sink, a cow whispers, and a horse barks."
When people were in such a situation, they believed that saying things the other way around, such as the following, would save their lives: "Stones flow, leaves sink, cows whisper, and horses bark."
sen.cmt: ・文章を改変しました。・括弧内の主語をすべて複数にしました。
sen.e: When people were in such a situation, they believed that saying things the other way around, such as the following, would save their lives: "Stones flow, leaves sink, cows whisper, and horses bark."

sen.j: またこの地の牛鬼は、猫のような体と一丈（約3.3メートル）もの尾を持ち、体が鞠のように柔らかいので歩いても足音がしないという。
sen.e: A cow demon in this region is said to have the body like a cat and a tail as long as 3.3 meter and walks without making any sound because its body is soft like a whip.
Also, this Ushioni was said to have had a body like a cat and a tail as long as about 3.3 meter and walked without making any sounds because its body was soft like a ball.
sen.cmt: ・文章を改変しました。・鞠は「まり」で、鞭ではないのでballに変更しました。
sen.e: Also, this Ushioni was said to have had a body like a cat and a tail as long as about 3.3 meter and walked without making any sounds because its body was soft like a ball.

sen.j: 酒が大好物なので、正月に酒を供えると牛鬼に襲われずに済むとも伝わる。
sen.e: It is also said that serving sake to it on the New Year prevents attacks of the cow demon because it likes sake very much.
It is also said that because Ushioni likes sake very much, serving sake to it in the New Year prevents attacking from it.
sen.cmt: ・文章を改変しました。・the New Yearの前置詞をinに変更しました。
sen.e: It is also said that because Ushioni likes sake very much, serving sake to it in the New Year prevents attacking from it.

sen.j: 高知県
sen.e: Kochi Prefecture
Kochi Prefecture
Kochi Prefecture

sen.j: 高知県では、明和3年（1776年）の大旱魃の年に岡内村（現・香美市）の次郎吉という男が、峯ノ川にて牛鬼を目撃したという。
sen.e: In Kochi Prefecture, a man named Jirokichi in Okanai village (present-day Kami City) is said to have seen a cow demon in the 1776 drought.
In Kochi Prefecture, it is said that a man named Jirokichi in Okanouchi Village (present-day Kami City) saw Ushioni in 1776, when a severe drought struck.

sen.e: In Kochi Prefecture, it is said that a man named Jirokichi in Okanouchi Village (present-day Kami City) saw Ushioni in 1776, when a severe drought struck.

sen.j: また同県の民話では、ある村で家畜の牛が牛鬼に食い殺され、退治しようとした村人もまた食い殺されていたところへ、話を耳にした近藤左近という武士が弓矢の一撃で退治した。
sen.e: A folklore in the prefecture says that a samurai named Sakon KONDO was successful in shooting an arrow to do away with the cow demon that had killed cows and the villagers that had tried to do away with it.

A folktale handed down in the prefecture says that when Ushioni bit and killed the cattle of a village and also the villagers who tried to do away with it, a samurai named Sakon KONDO heard it and came, and successfully killed it by shooting only an arrow.

sen.j: 村人たちは大喜びで、弓を引く真似をしながら左近の牛鬼退治の様子を話したという。
